intro: Mimulus rubellus, commonly known as the scarlet monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features bright red, tubular flowers that are highly attractive to pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. Mimulus rubellus thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in dry, rocky habitats.
